snippet: Though the league did not make an announcement after the deadline, which was midnight, it was presumed that the league had shut down.
abstract: Deadline for the NHL to avoid a lockout passes without a resolution, initiating the presumption that the league has shut down for the second time since 2004, and the third since Gary Bettman became commissioner in 1993.
lead_paragraph: Though the league did not make an announcement after the deadline, which was midnight, it was presumed that the league had shut down.

headline.seo: Sides Still Far Apart in N.H.L. Labor Dispute
headline.main: No Deal in N.H.L. Dispute as Lockout Deadline Passes
headline.print_headline: No Deal in N.H.L. Dispute As Lockout Deadline Passes
